metadata.name: Victory Lap Dialog
metadata.description:
By default, the victory lap dialog is only displayed after defeating The Lamb. This mod adds it to the rest of the ending bosses after a big chest has dropped. There's 2 exceptions: if you beat Isaac while holding The Polaroid or if you beat Satan while holding The Negative.
Mega Satan doesn't always drop a chest, but instead can go directly to a cutscene. To fix this, you can use one of these mods: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2908633985]No Auto-Cutscenes[/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2667845009]NO Mega Satan auto cutscene[/url], or [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=938928749]AlwaysVoid[/url].
If you're headed to The Beast then I'd suggest using: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2908633985]No Auto-Cutscenes[/url], [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2228672036]Victory Laps[/url], or [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2488877801]Victory Laps at Home[/url].
This mod uses a shader which allows us to draw over the HUD. I'd recommend installing: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2661947271]Shader Crash Fix[/url]. If the shader is causing any issues then you can delete the shaders.xml file that comes with this mod. The code will automatically fall back to using the normal renderer which draws under the HUD.
Mod Config Menu can be used to enable or disable the victory lap dialog. Disabling includes disabling it after The Lamb.
